result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Gregory Ehlert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment/school during the duration of the diversion agreement and provide the information to the Monroe County Justice Program Coordinator.

Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 40 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 240 hours of community service within 40 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

supervisions.notes:
**10/26/2017 - JOC amended to reflect Defendant granted Huber privileges.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 1 in 16CF280

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by agent.
Expungement granted if defendant successfully completes probation.

Probation may be terminated after 2 years if defendant has complied with all conditions of probation.

Undergo AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.

Comply with any assessments and no contacts per agent.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to complete 200 hours of community service.
